column4: in parted, print shows " 4      11.4GB  204GB  193GB  primary  ext3", i enter "resize 4 0 204GB", and it returns "Error: Can't have the end before the start!" - but the end isn't before the start??
it's not a resize operation if you're trying to move the beginning of a partition.
move says "use resize"
I'm not sure it's possible to do what you want with parted
i see.  know any alternatives?  using ubuntu server here
if I understand you correctly, you have a 204GB partition that is offset from the beginning of the disk by 11GB?
actually, i've just discovered that the important data on the partition isn't there at all.... so i guess i just reformat
hooray for backups :P
that'll be a lot easier anyway.

it's fine
when i run irrecord, i get: irrecord: could not get file information for /dev/lirc
you have to configure things correctly in /etc/lirc . It's a bit tricky

last time I checked, there wasn't much useful documentation for lirc in ubuntu, but if you look for help with recent Debian versions, the instructions should apply.
so i tried using irrecord to actually see if my remote is working, and now i'm stuck

additionally: "lircd: Permission denied"
you haven't got appropriate privileges. If you installed from ubuntu packages, you should use 'sudo invoke-rc.d lirc start' to start the daemon. Or maybe lircd, I'm not sure.
